text:
if I use the commit `Canonicalize file paths in modpath_from_file, this should help when receiving symlinks and whatnot.` https://github.com/PyCQA/astroid/commit/cda9dc4ad0e2cc075553d133dd0fdab468d614d7

title: ImportError: No module named text

text: Do make it sense this issue @PCManticore?
Looking into it, I'm not sure what is happening.

Can you please check with the latest commit? I can currently reproduce it and the commit seems to fix it, but unfortunately setting an automated test is kinda cumbersome, so I left out that part for now. Let me know if it works, so I could close the issue.

Steps:
- I build yesterday a docker container with the following [Dockerfile](https://gist.github.com/moylop260/5a47afc0ec209e66c41b1ca93af854e2)
- Ran the `entrypoint.sh` and I saw the error
- Update the last version of astroid today
- The issue is fixed

Image of example before and after update astroid:
![screen shot 2016-06-01 at 11 34 52 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6644187/15717499/e87001e0-27ec-11e6-981c-1cecb4111022.png)

Thank you @PCManticore üëç
